DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Mental Health Domain Cognitive Function Version 2.1 Past 7 Days Have Been Able to Remember to do Things Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of their ability to remember to do things, like take medicine or buy something they need, in the past 7 days, susing a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Mental Health Domain Cognitive Function Subordinate Domain Past Week Have Been Able to Remember to do Things Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's mental health._The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess perceived difficulties in intellectual processes, capabilities, and deficits._The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about whether an individual has or had been able to remember to do things, like take medicine or buy something they need._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Mental Health Domain Cognitive Function Subordinate Domain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses the status of an individual's mental health.:The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess perceived difficulties in intellectual processes, capabilities, and deficits.

The collection of PROMIS item scales that assess perceived difficulties in intellectual processes, capabilities, and deficits.

May include the present day.:A question about whether an individual has or had been able to remember to do things, like take medicine or buy something they need.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Have Been Able to Remember to do Things
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had been able to remember to do things, like take medicine or buy something they need.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PROMIS:Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System, PROMIS Health Organization and PROMIS Cooperative Group, 2008-2012

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores for representing how much of something an individual experiences from 1: Not at all, to 5: Very much.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for ECOG-ACRIN study in Rave. mc 5/4/15
